snippet: Noncitizens should be allowed to sue international corporations that do business in the United States for human rights abuses abroad.
abstract: Editorial urges the Supreme Court to accept a case brought by Nigerian citizens alleging that multinational oil companies, including Royal Dutch Shell, aided a military dictatorship that tortured and killed protesters from 1992 until 1995; contends that case, which would be first of its kind to be heard by court, is unlikely to expose American corporations to unfair claims abroad.
lead_paragraph: Noncitizens should be allowed to sue international corporations that do business in the United States for human rights abuses abroad.
